publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-5634 Bill Kidd: UK Tax and Benefits Poverty Trap—That the Parliament considers that, in light of two recent reports, An Anatomy of Economic Inequality in the UK and Measuring Severe Child Poverty in the UK, the UK Government has failed to lift people out of poverty and improve the lot of poorer members of society relative to wealthy members, giving rise to the impression that Conservative governments maintain the tax and benefit system to keep rich people rich and that Labour governments maintain the current tax and benefit system to keep poor people poor.

S3M-5634 Bill Kidd: UK Tax and Benefits Poverty Trap—That the Parliament considers that, in light of two recent reports, An Anatomy of Economic Inequality in the UK and Measuring Severe Child Poverty in the UK, the UK Government has failed to lift people out of poverty and improve the lot of poorer members of society relative to wealthy members, giving rise to the impression that Conservative governments maintain the tax and benefit system to keep rich people rich and that Labour governments maintain the current tax and benefit system to keep poor people poor. Supported by: John Wilson*, Alasdair Allan*, Bill Wilson*, Kenneth Gibson*
